text.title: Get the Most Money for a Pet You're Selling
text.head: Get the Most Money for a Pet You're Selling
text.p: When you're selling a pet, you'd naturally like to get the most money possible for it. Follow these steps to learn how to get the best deal when selling your pet.
text.head: Steps
Cleaning Up!

list.item: You'll have better luck if your pet has a nice personality. Make sure your pet doesn't bite or show aggression toward anyone, including other animals. If it does, include that information in your listing to let people know.

Clean your pet. Make sure he/she smells good and has a nice clean coat so the next owner won't have to clean it right away. You won't get a good price for your pet if it's not clean.
get some nice smelling shampoo
fill a bucket with warm water
rub water into the fur/hair
massage your pet slowly with the shampoo
rinse all of the shampoo out with water. If your pet was really dirty, you may need to wash it a second time
dry your pet
Brush the fur of your pet. Let birds groom themselves
Now, clip your pet's toenails, so when he/she gets to their new house they won't scratch furniture, floors, hands, etc.
If your pet has teeth, try your best to brush them.This is important because the more fully you groom your pet, the more likely you'll be to get a good price
Make sure that your pet is extremely well groomed and and looks perfect before moving on.

text.head: Make an ad

list.item: Take a picture of your pet. Make sure it looks wonderful!

POSTER: Make a poster that explains your pet. Describe how they act around strangers, people walking by, friends, children, any pets, etc. Mention your pet's personality and what activities he likes. Include a picture of your pet in the poster, and list your contact information. Place posters around town.

ONLINE AD:
Post an ad on craigslist
You could even create a website for your animal if you or a relative or friend have the skills and knowledge to accomplish that. You could incorporate several nice photos of your pet, and include all of the information mentioned above.

text.head: SELLING

list.item: Have a price in mind (which you can advertise if you like), but be ready to negotiate with a serious buyer
Once you've settled on a price, be prepared to send your pet off with his new owner, along with any pet supplies you care to include in the deal
If you had an ad on craigslist, take it down. Remove any posters you put up, and if you started a website, either close it down or change it to another use.
If you find you're feeling lonely without your pet, it may be time to start thinking about getting another pet.
